etymologies: Old English snæg(e)l, of Germanic origin; related to German Schnecke

definitions: a mollusk with a single spiral shell into which the whole body can be withdrawn.

notes.text: Most orders in the class Gastropoda

shortDefinitions: mollusc with single spiral shell into which whole body can be withdrawn

definitions: (in metaphorical use) any person or thing that moves exceedingly slowly

examples.text: a tedious and complicated process enough to exasperate a snail

shortDefinitions: used in reference to something very slow
